Description: Gini coefficient measures the degree of income inequality on a 0-1 scale. The more equal the income distribution, the lower the Gini coefficient.
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Index measure of intergenerational upward mobility, based on inter-generational household income differentials
Source: Equal Opportunity Project, Harvard University
Threshold Rationale: Best value, worst value and dashboard set according to 2018 SDSN US Cities Index.

Description: Disparity in employment rates between American Indian and Alaskan Natives to white, non-Hispanics who worked full-time year round in past 12 months
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to Leave No One Behind.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Index of dissimilarity where higher values indicate greater residential segregation between black and white county residents
Source: County Health Rankings, University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to eliminate discriminatory laws, policies, and practices.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Municipal Equality Index score assessing LGBTQ inclusivity of laws, policies, and services. City-level data for main city used as a proxy for MSA.
Source: Municipal Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign Foundation & Equality Federation Institute
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to Leave No One Behind.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Percentage of occupied housing units with >1 occupant per room
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to ensure access for all to adequate, safe, and affordable housing.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.

Description: Percentage of commuters 16 and over using public transport, bicycles, carpooling, or walking to work
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to expert guidance.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to expert guidance and summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering

Description: Percentage of population living within a half mile of a park
Source: National Environmental Public Health Tracking Network, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to provide universal access to green and public spaces.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Weighted Annual Mean of PM 2.5 concentration
Source: Air Quality Statistics Report, Environmental Protection Agency
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to WHO Air Quality Guidelines. Worst value set according to EPA Air Quality Index. Dashboard set according to EPA Air Quality Index categories.

Description: Percentage of renters paying 30% or more of their income on rent
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to ensure access for all to affordable housing.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.

Description: The 4th highest daily maximum 8-hour average Ozone level in the year (ppm)
Source: Air Quality Statistics Report, Environmental Protection Agency
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to EPA Air Quality Index. Worst value set according to EPA Air Quality Index. Dashboard set according to EPA Air Quality Index categories.

Description: Pounds of toxic release, weighted by toxicity
Source: Toxic Release Inventory National Analysis, Environmental Protection Agency
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Annual percentage change in toxic chemicals released into air from production-related waste, in pounds per square mile, 2012-2017
Source: Toxic Release Inventory National Analysis, Environmental Protection Agency
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5. Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to expert guidance.

Description: Production-based greenhouse gas emissions per capita
Units: Metric tons of carbon dioxide equivalent (tCO2e)
Source: Samuel A Markolf et al 2017 Environ. Res. Lett. 12 024003
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to scientific standard (Deep Decarbonization Pathways Project Target). Worst value set according to scientific standard (EPA emissions standard). Dashboard set according to 2018 SDSN US Cities Index.
Changes from 2018: New source, covers; production-related GHG emissions rather than consumption-related CO2 emissions

Description: Estimated percentage of adults who think global warming is happening
Source: Yale Climate Opinion Maps, Yale Program on Climate Change Communication
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Binary variable, does city have a local adaptation plan (0=no, 1=yes)
Source: Adaptation Clearinghouse, Georgetown Climate Center
Threshold Rationale: Best value set to "has local adaptation plan." Worst value set according to "Does not have local adaptation plan." Dashboard set to binary red/green scale.

Description: Percentage  of city area that is parkland. City-level data for main city used as a proxy for MSA.
Source: City Parks Facts, The Trust for Public Land
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Percentage of city park area that is natural parkland. City-level data for main city used as a proxy for MSA.
Source: City Parks Facts, The Trust for Public Land
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Annual percentage change in toxic chemicals released into land from production-related waste, in pounds per square mile, 2012-2017
Source: Toxic Release Inventory National Analysis, Environmental Protection Agency
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to expert guidance.

Description: Prison and jail incarceration rate per 100,000 aged 15 to 64
Source: Vera Institute of Justice
Threshold Rationale: Best value, worst value and dashboard set according to Global SDG Index.

Description: Prison admissions per 100,000 aged 15-64
Source: Vera Institute of Justice
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to the Cut50 national initiative.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Deaths by firearm per 100,000. Includes homicide, suicide, legal intervention and war related deaths.
Source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to 2018 SDSN US City Index.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Difference between non-white population share and non-white representation in government. City-level data for main city used as a proxy for MSA.
Source: The Reflective Democracy Campaign
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to ensure representative decision-making at all levels.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Percentage of population living below national poverty line
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to halve poverty. Worst value set according to 2018 SDSN US Cities Index. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Percentage of children living below twice the poverty line
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to eradicate extreme poverty for all. Worst value set according to 2018 SDSN US Cities Index. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Percentage of population aged 16-64 living below the poverty level and working full-time, year-round
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to zero deprivation: end poverty.  Worst value set using 2.5th percentile and adjusted further for skewness and kurtosis. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Paid sick leave policy, approved or enacted as of 2019 (0= no, 1= yes). MSA receives a score of 1 if: there is a state-wide policy; at least one main city within the MSA has a policy; or at least one county within the MSA has a policy.
Source: National Partnership for Women and Families & Institute for Women's Policy Research, Workplace Fairness, & Willis Towers Watson
Threshold Rationale: Best value set to "Requires paid sick leave." Worst value set according to "Does not require paid sick leave." Dashboard set to binary red/green scale.

Description: Paid family/parental leave policy for municipal employees, approved or enacted as of May 2018 (0= no, 1= yes). MSA receives a score of 1 if: there is a state-wide policy; at least one main city within the MSA has a policy; or at least one county within the MSA has a policy.
Source: National Partnership for Women and Families
Threshold Rationale: Best value set to "Requires paid family leave." Worst value set according to "Does not require paid family leave." Dashboard set to binary red/green scale.

Description: Percentage estimates of individuals experiencing food insecurity
Source: Feeding America
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to end hunger. Worst value set according to 2018 SDSN US Cities Index. Dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.

Description: Percentage of population with low-access to large grocery stores (more than 1 mile from a supermarket, supercenter or large grocery store in an urban area)
Source: Food Environment Atlas, US Department of Agriculture
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to ensure access to sufficient food for all.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.

Description: Percentage of adults that report a BMI ≥ 30
Source: County Health Rankings, University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Infant mortality rate (per 1,000 live births)
Source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDSN US State Index.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.

Description: Estimated number of fatal road traffic injuries to pedestrians, bicyclists and motorists per 100,000 people
Source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according SDG mandate to halve deaths and injuries from road traffic accidents.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Age-adjusted death rate for non-communicable diseases (chronic respiratory, diabetes, cancer, cardiovascular) per 100,000 people aged 35-74
Source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.

Description: Average number of mentally unhealthy days reported in past 30 days (age-adjusted)
Source: County Health Rankings, University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Number of deaths due to drug poisoning per 100,000 population
Source: County Health Rankings, University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value and dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.

Description: Age-adjusted life expectancy from birth
Source: County Health Rankings, University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute using National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDSN US State Index.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.

Description: Percentage of the population with health insurance
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to universal access: public service.  Worst value and dashboard set according to 2018 SDSN US Cities Index.
Changes from 2018: Moved indicator from SDG 10 to SDG 3

Description: Percentage of population aged 3-4 enrolled in school
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to ensure that all have access to pre-primary education.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Percentage of the population aged 25-34 with a bachelor’s degree or higher
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Percentage of ninth-grade cohort that graduates in four years
Source: County Health Rankings, University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Percentage-point disparity in attending a high poverty school (>75% Free and Reduced Price Lunch) between white people and people of color
Source: PolicyLink/PERE, National Equity Atlas
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to Leave No One Behind.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Percentage of men’s earnings that women earn, when comparing full-time workers over the age of 16
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to end all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere. Worst value set using 2.5th percentile and adjusted further for skewness and kurtosis. Dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.

Description: Percentage of individual-owned businesses that are owned by women. Excludes businesses owned by both women and men, and is limited to businesses whose ownership can be classified by gender (excludes jointly owned and publicly owned firms)
Source: Survey of Business Owners, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to ensure women’s full and effective participation.  Worst value and dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.

Description: Percentage of women in city government. City-level data for main cities used as a proxy for MSA.
Source: The Reflective Democracy Campaign
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to ensure women’s full and effective participation.  Worst value and dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.

Description: Population-weighted average of the percent of population in each county served by a community water system with at least one Safe Drinking Water Act violation
Source: Natural Resources Defense Council, using EPA
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to SDG mandate to achieve universal and equitable access to safe and affordable drinking water for all.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Domestic water use, in gallons per person per day
Source: US Geological Survey
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5. Worst value set using 2.5th percentile and adjusted further for skewness and kurtosis. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.

Description: Annual percentage change in toxic chemicals released into water from production-related waste, in pounds per square mile, 2012-2017
Source: Toxic Release Inventory National Analysis, Environmental Protection Agency
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to expert guidance.

Description: Percentage of income spent on household energy by those at less than 50% of the poverty level
Source: Fisher Sheehan & Colton, Home Energy Affordability Gap
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to expert guidance. Worst value set using 2.5th percentile and adjusted further for skewness and kurtosis. Dashboard set according to expert guidance.

Description: Percentage of energy produced within the state from wind, solar, geothermal, biomass and hydroelectric. Value of the state was applied to all MSAs within the state.
Source: US Energy Information Administration
Threshold Rationale: Best value, worst value and dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.
Changes from 2018: Changed from low-carbon energy generation to renewable production

Description: Percentage of energy consumed within the state from wind, solar, geothermal, biomass and hydroelectric. Value of the state was applied to all MSAs within the state.
Source: US Energy Information Administration
Threshold Rationale: Best value, worst value and dashboard set according to SDSN US State Index.

Description: 5-year average of annual real GDP percentage growth rates
Source: Bureau of Economic Analysis
Threshold Rationale: Best value, worst value and dashboard set according to 2018 SDSN US City Index.

Indicator name: Youth not in employment, education or training (NEET)
Description: Percentage of youth aged 16-24 who are not enrolled in school (full- or part-time) and not employed (full- or part-time)
Source: Measure of America
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5. Worst value and dashboard set according to 2018 SDSN US Cities Index.

Description: Unemployment rate, ages 20-64
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.
Changes from 2018: New source, and updated calculation methodology

Description: Percentage of workers 16 and over in computer, science, engineering, healthcare practitioner and technical occupations
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value, worst value and dashboard set according to 2018 SDSN US Cities Index.
Changes from 2018: Moved indicator from SDG 8 to SDG 9

Description: Utility patent grants per 1,000 individuals in STEM occupations (includes computer, science, engineering, healthcare practitioner and technical occupations)
Source: US Patent and Trademark Office & American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to average of top 5. Worst value set using 2.5th percentile and adjusted further for skewness and kurtosis. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.
Changes from 2018: Changed denominator from all workers to STEM workers

Description: Percentage of households with broadband internet subscription, such as cable, fiber optic or DSL
Source: American Community Survey, US Census Bureau
Threshold Rationale: Best value set according to universal access: public service.  Worst value set according to 2.5th percentile. Dashboard set according to summary statistics, and adjusted for clustering.
